CatDescriptText: Mr. William Jackson, manufacturer's representative, Weirton, W. Va., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 22, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the visit of the Russian ruler, Khrushchev, will promote world peace?" answer reads: "It certainly will not hurt, that's if the people hold their heads and treat him with the same courtesy that the Russians extended to Nixon. I believe that a lot of things can be accomplished and perhaps we will sway Khrushchev into our way of thinking and living."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William Jackson wearing diagonally striped necktie and light colored flecked suit jacket, standing under Jenkins Arcade marquee, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
